ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: with a rope of twisted fibre round her neck.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Will have a strap of fibre rope around her neck.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: upon her neck shall be a rope of palm-fibre.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and so too will his wife who (threw thorns and firewood in the Prophet's way). Around her neck will be a rope of palm fibre.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: A rope made from palm fibre around her neck!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: In her neck is a twisted rope of Masad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Upon her neck a halter of strongly twisted rope.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: upon her neck a rope of palm-fibre.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Will have upon her neck a halter of palm-fibre.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: with a rope of twisted fibre round her neck.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: On her neck shall be a cord of twisted fibre.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: with a rope of palm fibre around her neck.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: A twisted rope of palm-leaf fibre round her (own) neck!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: In her neck is a twisted rope of Masad (palm fibre).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: shall have a rope of palmfiber around her neck!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Around her neck is a rope of thorns.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [111:5] with a rope of palm-fibre around her neck (fī jīdihā hablun min masadin is a circumstantial qualifier referring to hammālata’l-hatab, which in turn is [either] a description of imra’atahu, ‘his wife’, or the predicate of an implied subject). Meccan or Medinese, consisting of 4 or 5 verses. The Prophet (s) was asked about his Lord and the following was revealed:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Will have upon her neck a halter of palm fibre) and this halter strangulated her and she died as a result; it is also said that this means: she will have an iron chain on her neck'. And of the surah in which Unity is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 4 verses, 15 words and 47 777 letters: Surah 112: The Sincerity (al-lkhlas) And of the surah in which Unity is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 4 verses, 15 words and 47 letters:
